data.name: Hatchobori
data.description: A hidden neighborhood filled with small parks and local restaurants with easy access to Disneyland.

city_gems.name: Cafe Ajito .N
city_gems.shortDescription: The sheep standing outside is sure to catch your attention.
city_gems.longDescription: A sheep stands guard here, where you can try lamb taco rice and a unique dates and almond latte.

city_gems.name: Teppozu Inari Shrine
city_gems.shortDescription: A shrine that has been relocated many times.
city_gems.longDescription: Nestled in a residential area, it's quiet and peaceful. Don’t miss the mini Mount Fuji at the back made of lava from it that you can walk up.

city_gems.name: Senmaiya
city_gems.shortDescription: Classic and tasty onigiri made with love.
city_gems.longDescription: It is a tiny shop with a wide selection of onigiri (rice balls), with brown rice as an option. Simple, tasty, ready to make your belly happy.

city_gems.name: Kinome
city_gems.shortDescription: A highly hospitable izakaya.
city_gems.longDescription: Enjoy set meals with seasonal ingredients prepared by friendly staff. Open for both lunch and dinner.

city_gems.name: Torifuku
city_gems.shortDescription: 50 year old cozy traditional restaurant.
city_gems.longDescription: Serves bentos with perfectly grilled chicken skewers and more. Free plum wine for the ladies during dinner.

city_gems.name: Hifuki-otoko Hyottoko
city_gems.shortDescription: A grill specialty restaurant using high-quality ingredients.
city_gems.longDescription: Feast on seafood grilled over charcoal. When inside, try to spot the wooden turtle on the wall there!

city_gems.name: Co-Side Cafe
city_gems.shortDescription: Quaint cafe with a simple menu and cute dessert.
city_gems.longDescription: Stop by for a cup of lemonade and their signature tuna-shaped mochi wafer.

city_gems.name: Kamenote
city_gems.shortDescription: A fine dining date spot.
city_gems.longDescription: French-Japanese fusion course meals made with fresh ingredients from Tsukiji.

city_gems.name: Flower Works
city_gems.shortDescription: A flower shop with an impressive interior.
city_gems.longDescription: Adopt a plant or get a bouquet for someone special here! Look out for a pair of shoes used as a flower pot.

city_gems.name: Hitosara Handmade Chasoba
city_gems.shortDescription: A fresh soba noodle restaurant.
city_gems.longDescription: Whet your appetite by watching how your noodles are made! This restaurant is run by a very friendly couple and you can try either hot or cold soba here. The soba crackers are also a must try.

city_gems.name: Craft Beer Bar iBrew Ginza
city_gems.shortDescription: A heaven of tiny label beers.
city_gems.longDescription: Get your craft beer fix in this restaurant, stocking both local and international options. Marvel at an impressive tap display and their 20 beer flight set.

city_gems.name: Turret Coffee
city_gems.shortDescription: Craft matcha latte by a former fish monger.
city_gems.longDescription: You can't miss the bright red bench outside this cafe. Both artsy and eccentric, the menu features seasonal lattes and hot spiced cider.

city_gems.name: Motodane
city_gems.shortDescription: Where you can get a 1.5 person portion of sushi at an unbeatable price.
city_gems.longDescription: Wonder what it's like to dine with a Japanese family? Wonder no more if you enter through the side entrance of this sushi restaurant (probably a part of the owner's house) where you are greeted by kind locals and served the freshest catch at unbeatable prices.

city_gems.name: Nihombashi Sando
city_gems.shortDescription: Modern izakaya with classic dishes.
city_gems.longDescription: The izakaya to go to if you are looking to sample Japanese dishes of the highest quality. Fresh sashimi, perfectly fried cream croquettes, and sake from Nagano are among visitor's favorites here.

city_gems.name: Bongen Coffee
city_gems.shortDescription: Bonsai, zen and a milky cup of latte.
city_gems.longDescription: It may be tiny but the coffee here packs a punch. Its bonsai logo is iconic and well-known, so don't be surprised to see a queue forming outside. Coffee made with premium Geisha beans is also available for purchase here.

city_gems.name: Maru
city_gems.shortDescription: A hidden wine and dine spot.
city_gems.longDescription: If you're a wine lover, you can't skip this spot. You'll be impressed by the bottles of wine lined up along the wall. Tapas served there includes asparagus gratin and anchovy butter fries that will satisfy any light cravings.

city_gems.name: Burger Shop Do
city_gems.shortDescription: Bite into juicy burgers here.
city_gems.longDescription: Good burgers are sometimes hard to come by in Tokyo, but this shop has your back. Aside from the classics, you can check out their weekly burgers in store. They also serve free vegetable juice on the side.

city_gems.name: 2F Coffee
city_gems.shortDescription: Perfect for an afternoon tea snack.
city_gems.longDescription: Need a quiet afternoon to yourself to read? This laidback cafe has the right atmosphere for it. Have a muffin or pudding to go with your coffee here.

data.name: Shimbashi
data.description: A bustling after-work hangout for salarymen, filled with the most authentic of izakayas.

city_gems.name: SL Square (Shimbashi Station West Entrance Square)
city_gems.shortDescription: A cool locomotive train right outside a train station.
city_gems.longDescription: This spot is a favorite meeting point, featuring a charming 1940s steam locomotive. The area is beautifully illuminated at night!

city_gems.name: Kenele Stand Shimbashi Station
city_gems.shortDescription: Your one stop crash course to capsule toys.
city_gems.longDescription: Capsule toys are an unescapable sight in Japan. Be it miniatures of everyday items or the most creative concepts brought to life in a toy, you'll enjoy browsing these machines and maybe bringing some back as souvenir!

city_gems.name: NTV Big Clock
city_gems.shortDescription: A steampunk clock designed by Hayao Miyazaki.
city_gems.longDescription: This clock is at the headquarters of Nippon Television. It is designed by Hayao Miyazaki, director of the Ghibli films. It is a captivating steampunk timepiece with animated features. It performs a show three minutes before the hour at 12 p.m., 1 p.m., 3 p.m., 6 p.m., and 8 p.m. on weekdays, plus an additional 10 a.m. show on weekends. Try to arrive early to enjoy the full experience!

city_gems.name: Peace Coffee Roasters
city_gems.shortDescription: Cafe with an impressive coffee drip display.
city_gems.longDescription: This is a great place for grabbing coffee to catch up with a friend or come to solo to read a book. It also serves a delectable range of pastries.

city_gems.name: Sustainable Food Museum
city_gems.shortDescription: Learn about the latest sustainable food inventions from different countries here.
city_gems.longDescription: Part museum, part cafe, you can spend a little bit of time reading about the different kinds of sustainable food and items on display here. This spot also sells healthy onigiri and occasionally holds educational events.

city_gems.name: Atelier Yamagata
city_gems.shortDescription: A shop that repurposes kimono into novelty items.
city_gems.longDescription: A shop that flies under a radar. It is run by a kind older lady who creates small pouches and other accessories out of different kimono fabrics.

city_gems.name: Kiraku
city_gems.shortDescription: Ramen joint that serves delicious chukasoba and tsukemen.
city_gems.longDescription: This tiny restaurant has 9 seats and serves ramen with a punch. Its soup is a blend of chicken and seafood while the noodles are chewy and handmade.

city_gems.name: Sowa
city_gems.shortDescription: Handmade ice cream available in unique local flavors.
city_gems.longDescription: Try gelato, soft serve, and sherbet in this cute little shop that has been opened since 1955. Enjoy local flavors like sesame, matcha, red bean. Look out for seasonal flavors like watermelon and cinnamon.

city_gems.name: Shimbashi Bar Delta
city_gems.shortDescription: A welcoming bar for tourists that has a wide selection of whiskeys.
city_gems.longDescription: The atmosphere is calm and cozy, featuring an impressive display of whiskey bottles and the bartender loves to share his knowledge about whiskey. It's a spot you can feel comfortable visiting alone.

city_gems.name: Kunisuwa Brewery
city_gems.shortDescription: A local brewery with an impressive storefront that also sells stationery.
city_gems.longDescription: A great spot to sample different kinds of freshly brewed beers. Recommended food items to try are the roast beef and smoked duck. The owner of the place also runs a bespoke printing service and has a selection of stationary items for sale on the second floor.

city_gems.name: Sushi Garyu
city_gems.shortDescription: Learn to make sushi here.
city_gems.longDescription: Try making your own sushi here under the guidance of skilled chefs. The lessons are conducted in English. If you would prefer to just enjoy a meal, premium omakase (the chef's recommendation) courses are also available.

city_gems.name: Nandhini
city_gems.shortDescription: Tokyo's best South Indian restaurant.
city_gems.longDescription: This is a restaurant loved by both locals and visitors for its authentic flavors. The chefs, who come from South India, bring their expertise to dishes like biryani, chicken Hyderabadi, dosas, and paneer curries, all made with a lot of care. It offers vegan and vegetarian options, making it a versatile choice for different dietary preferences.

city_gems.name: Comfort Stand
city_gems.shortDescription: A minimalist cafe that serves milk brew.
city_gems.longDescription: Featuring a relaxed vibe and cosy decor, you can enjoy fresh coffee and pastries here. It is an ideal escape from Tokyo's busy streets.

city_gems.name: Kuunomu Okashi
city_gems.shortDescription: Simple and effective - only one lunch set choice guaranteed to be good.
city_gems.longDescription: A shop filled with vintage furniture that serves limited lunch sets per day. The sets get sold out quickly so it's best to go earlier.

city_gems.name: Shinshodoh
city_gems.shortDescription: Famous for a specialty bean cake great as a souvenir.
city_gems.longDescription: If you're looking for sweet souvenirs to bring back, here's a good spot to drop by! Try their famous Seppuku Monaka, a Japanese wafer cake overflowing with red bean. Other seasonal sweets are also available.

city_gems.name: Urban Famima
city_gems.shortDescription: An upgraded convenience store experience you don't want to miss.
city_gems.longDescription: If you love convenience stores, you'll be impressed by this unique one. The essentials are stocked but it also features collaboration items as well as Family Mart's own line of clothes.

city_gems.name: T-Market
city_gems.shortDescription: Food options for indecisive parties in a very cool space.
city_gems.longDescription: Possibly the coolest food court in Tokyo - a dim-lit setting, lots of plants, and trendy food options ranging from modern Japanese to ethnic fusion dishes.

city_gems.name: Seishoji Temple
city_gems.shortDescription: Zen Buddhist temple in the middle of the city.
city_gems.longDescription: Find peace and tranquility in the middle of the city here. It also offers monthly  Zen meditation sessions, though it is only available in Japanese at the moment.

city_gems.name: Atago Shrine
city_gems.shortDescription: A beautiful shrine with iconic stairs leading up to it.
city_gems.longDescription: It is a historic Shinto shrine founded in the early 1600s, famous for its steep 86-step staircase. There's a belief that conquering them in leads to success in life. From the top is a beautiful view, which used to serve as a safety point for residents to watch out for fires or escape to in the event of a fire.

data.name: Ueno
data.description: A cultural hotspot, home to pandas, museums, and the city's most relaxing park.

city_gems.name: Milk Stand
city_gems.shortDescription: A milk specialty shop.
city_gems.longDescription: Get to try rare milk brands and flavors not found in supermarkets and convenience stores. Take-out only.

city_gems.name: Torijin
city_gems.shortDescription: Yakitori izakaya where each item is grilled with pride.
city_gems.longDescription: Savor flavorful yakitori and sashimi in this welcoming izakaya led by a jovial and eccentric owner.

city_gems.name: Egg Baby Cafe
city_gems.shortDescription: Everything on their food menu includes eggs.
city_gems.longDescription: If their name didn’t catch your attention, their creative spin on egg dishes will. Sandwiches, pasta, and creative-looking desserts are available here.

city_gems.name: Sankouen
city_gems.shortDescription: Green tea specialty store in Ameyoko.
city_gems.longDescription: A shop all about green, selling rich blends of green tea and tasty seaweed.

city_gems.name: Yoshimi Shokudo
city_gems.shortDescription: A great place to dine with the locals.
city_gems.longDescription: Eatery that uses seasonal ingredients in set meals, a popular lunch spot for salarymen.

city_gems.name: Mitsubachi
city_gems.shortDescription: Beautifully presented Japanese cubed jelly dessert in a bowl.
city_gems.longDescription: Enjoy traditional Japanese sweets in this little dessert shop with a long history.

city_gems.name: Jalana Coffee
city_gems.shortDescription: Half cafe, half original clothing store.
city_gems.longDescription: Trendy shop with a fashionable clothing section at the back that serves coffee, craft beers, and sandwiches.

city_gems.name: Matsuya Seiniku
city_gems.shortDescription: A hamburg specialty restaurant.
city_gems.longDescription: The patties here are tender and are made with a recipe that has been passed down for 5 generations. The set meal options are highly customizable.

city_gems.name: Shiten Coffee
city_gems.shortDescription: Minimalist cafe serving delicious coffees.
city_gems.longDescription: Corner street cafe with specialty coffee that's great for people-watching. Offers a quick break from the bustling neighborhood.

city_gems.name: Kamoichi Wine
city_gems.shortDescription: A rare spot where you can try high-quality duck sushi.
city_gems.longDescription: Ducks rule the world, that's what this restaurant serving duck sushi and natural wines believes. We agree.

city_gems.name: Hantsuma
city_gems.shortDescription: Showa-era style exterior hides tasty skewers on the inside.
city_gems.longDescription: An izakaya with a retro atmosphere that cooks up perfectly fried Osaka-style skewers.

city_gems.name: Chika
city_gems.shortDescription: Its name means basement, and you can enjoy sake down there.
city_gems.longDescription: A basement izakaya that offers an affordable sake pairing experience with light dishes - a great snacking experience.

city_gems.name: Harukoya
city_gems.shortDescription: The most unique menu on their item here is fish tempura.
city_gems.longDescription: Tantalizing tempura here is paired best with a mean lemon sour. The staff are extremely energetic and friendly, happy to share their recommendations.

city_gems.name: Matsuura Shokudo
city_gems.shortDescription: Flavorful traditional dishes with a wide sake menu.
city_gems.longDescription: Must-try items here include chinese meat dumplings, oden, and unique Japanese cocktails.

city_gems.name: Shinobazu Brewery
city_gems.shortDescription: A cool micro-brewery in Ueno.
city_gems.longDescription: Indulge in a selection of lamb dishes and local craft beers on tap here.

city_gems.name: Sakaba Tanabota
city_gems.shortDescription: A calm basement izakaya with a few unusual dishes.
city_gems.longDescription: Hidden izakaya with a unique meat-potato dish you might need to get seconds of.

city_gems.name: Niki no Kashi
city_gems.shortDescription: For last-minute snack shopping, come here.
city_gems.longDescription: Massive shop that stocks a large variety of seasonal Japanese snacks at great prices.

city_gems.name: Hashiro
city_gems.shortDescription: Has seafood lunch sets that change on a frequent basis.
city_gems.longDescription: Izakaya specialized in affordable seafood lunch sets, served by a passionate ojisan who used to be a marathon runner and bartender in Shinjuku.

city_gems.name: 2k540 Aki-oka Artisan
city_gems.shortDescription: An entire street of artisan shops hidden under train tracks.
city_gems.longDescription: There are many different shops that sell leather goods, clothing, bags, and artisan items. It's a great place to spend an hour or two.

city_gems.name: Rantei Ponta
city_gems.shortDescription: A breaded pork cutlet that is lightly fried.
city_gems.longDescription: A rare find - breaded pork cutlet cooked at low temperatures to become very tender.

city_gems.name: Sushi Ko
city_gems.shortDescription: Watch your delicious sushi be handmade by chefs here, at affordable prices.
city_gems.longDescription: Tourists love this spot and mention a lot of melt-in-your-mouth ingredients. An English menu is also available here. The wait is worth it.

city_gems.name: Jugemu
city_gems.shortDescription: Soft and creamy octopus balls.
city_gems.longDescription: Cheap and tasty Osaka-style takoyaki served here! Have a beer on the side with their value set.

city_gems.name: Sabo Matsuo
city_gems.shortDescription: A lovely cafe to spend an afternoon in.
city_gems.longDescription: The highlight here is a 3 tiered sweet and savory afternoon tea platter sure to delight your tastebuds. It's a good spot to spend an afternoon to rest and catch up with a companion.

city_gems.name: Art Teahouse Shino
city_gems.shortDescription: Half gallery, half cafe that serves Japanese sweets.
city_gems.longDescription: A spot for the matcha fans, with the owner’s personal art collection for viewing on the side.

city_gems.name: Karinto Kagetsu
city_gems.shortDescription: Specialty shop that sells sweet crunchy snacks.
city_gems.longDescription: Get some deep fried brown sugar snacks in kimono-printed packaging that is sure to be a pleasant surprise for friends and family back home.

city_gems.name: Bäckerei Thüringer Wald
city_gems.shortDescription: An authentic German bread bakery.
city_gems.longDescription: An interesting find in Tokyo - authentic German bread that is popular with the locals for when you're feeling something different.

city_gems.name: Toritsune
city_gems.shortDescription: Luxurious chicken and egg over rice.
city_gems.longDescription: Oyakodon is a dish of runny egg and tender chicken over rice and this shop does it best since it's been doing it for a century.

city_gems.name: Tanbo Budou
city_gems.shortDescription: Simple and beautifully presented ingredients in a lunch set.
city_gems.longDescription: Each set meal is crafted with a variety of ingredients and placed on colorful plateware. There are 3 lunch sets to choose from and all are guaranteed to be delicious.

city_gems.name: Yushima Tenjin
city_gems.shortDescription: A underrated neighborhood shrine.
city_gems.longDescription: It is famous for hosting a plum blossom festival and a power spot for praying for academic success.

city_gems.name: Kufuku
city_gems.shortDescription: Traditional facade on the outside, modern cuisine on the inside.
city_gems.longDescription: Savor French-Japanese cuisine courses served in an old wooden residential house, a treat for a special occasion or for lovers of curated food experiences.

city_gems.name: Tempura Tensho
city_gems.shortDescription: Century old tempura shop hidden away from plain sight.
city_gems.longDescription: The value for money lunch sets here give you a generous topping of perfectly fried tempura consisting of shrimp, Japanese green pepper, and maitake mushrooms. The ingredients may change with the seasons.

city_gems.name: Nagino-Ki
city_gems.shortDescription: A women-run izakaya operating since the Showa era.
city_gems.longDescription: Dig into an obanzai-style meal where you get to select what you want from huge fresh dishes on display. If you like picking your food based on sight, this is a good spot to do so. Pair your dishes with readily available sake and shochu.

city_gems.name: Nanbu Hyakusho
city_gems.shortDescription: A popular izakaya that serves a wide variety of meat and fish dishes.
city_gems.longDescription: Step back in time with this izakaya’s elaborate atmosphere and savor dishes found in Japan’s northern region.

city_gems.name: Yushima Hall
city_gems.shortDescription: Trendy non-lit izakaya with quirky dishes.
city_gems.longDescription: This izakaya specializes in Japanese-Chinese fusion cuisine. Some of their dishes, like the potato salad, is presented in a quirky and photogenic way. You'll also find plenty of little rubber ducks in random places, it's certainly an Instagrammable spot.

city_gems.name: Shinobazu Pond
city_gems.shortDescription: An impressive pond with lotus plants and swan boats.
city_gems.longDescription: This pond is worth a visit at all times of the year. Sakura trees line the path around the pond in spring while the pond is filled with beautiful lotus flowers in summer. There are benches around to sit on for a casual picnic or you and your companion could pedal around the water on a swan boat.

city_gems.name: Ameyoko
city_gems.shortDescription: Best place for last minute souvenir shopping.
city_gems.longDescription: Shopping street running under train tracks considered a souvenir paradise for many.

data.name: Hamamatsucho
data.description: A haven for late-night ramen runs and home to two huge gardens beautiful in all seasons.

city_gems.name: Zojoji Temple
city_gems.shortDescription: A temple that dates back to the 1600s.
city_gems.longDescription: This large temple a picturesque view of Tokyo Tower. It is peaceful, filled with a lot of greenery and has a small section filled with Jizo statutes.

city_gems.name: Men Kurai
city_gems.shortDescription: Chewy and delightful ramen noodles.
city_gems.longDescription: Not your ordinary shoyu ramen! The noodles here are made with mochi flour so it's much chewier. The soup is a special blend of chicken, bonito, dried sardines, and kelp.

city_gems.name: Takeuchi
city_gems.shortDescription: Dine on a boat.
city_gems.longDescription: Indulge yourself with a course meal on a Japanese party boat that cruises around Sumida River. Private reservations available for big groups.

city_gems.name: Byron Bay Coffee Company
city_gems.shortDescription: Neighborhood cafe with Australian influences.
city_gems.longDescription: Start your day with a fresh latte at this Australian cafe with a neat selection of desserts. The staff are friendly and it has a point card to motivate you to keep coming back.

city_gems.name: Akitaya
city_gems.shortDescription: Corner street shop selling meat skewers.
city_gems.longDescription: Old-school izakaya specializing in meat and offal skewers. It's so tasty that there’s a queue before opening time.

city_gems.name: Noli et Nori
city_gems.shortDescription: Patisserie with fresh cream puffs and cakes.
city_gems.longDescription: Stocked with unique Japanese jams and sells highly coveted fresh loaves of bread from 11am that sell out quickly.

city_gems.name: Hamarikyu Gardens
city_gems.shortDescription: A garden with an Edo-period layout.
city_gems.longDescription: It is a massive garden with a traditional teahouse and seasonal blooms. There are many spots to capture the juxtaposition of nature and modern buildings from.

city_gems.name: Takezushi
city_gems.shortDescription: Voluminous sushi lunch sets await you.
city_gems.longDescription: 60 years in operation, serving up reasonable omakase meals by a funny sushi chef.

city_gems.name: Eight Coffee
city_gems.shortDescription: Minimalist cafe great for a quick break.
city_gems.longDescription: Minimalist cafe with coffee and hot dogs for those on the go. It also sells coffee vouchers to encourage you to be a regular patron.

city_gems.name: Udon Jinza
city_gems.shortDescription: A famous udon restaurant chain in Tokyo.
city_gems.longDescription: There are plenty of hearty udon options available here. Try their high-quality tender pork as a topping.

data.name: Ginza
data.description: Tokyo's flashy entertainment district, where luxury boutiques and gourmet eateries make for the chicest stroll.

city_gems.name: Ginza Six Rooftop
city_gems.shortDescription: Look down at Ginza's bustling streets.
city_gems.longDescription: Contains a secret shrine and gives you free views of Ginza’s streets.

city_gems.name: And People Ginza
city_gems.shortDescription: A restaurant that looks like a scene out of a movie.
city_gems.longDescription: The perfect spot for a romantic night out; enjoy Italian cuisine and cocktails here.

city_gems.name: Bar Butler
city_gems.shortDescription: A tiny bar run by a charming bartender.
city_gems.longDescription: Sip on the finest classic cocktails and whiskey selection in a dim-lit setting.

city_gems.name: Daitsune Udon
city_gems.shortDescription: Lunch haven for working adults that puts a twist on traditional udon.
city_gems.longDescription: Super affordable udon with both hot and cold options available. There is an English menu too. The most unique item on the menu might be the avocado udon.

city_gems.name: Dover Street Market Ginza
city_gems.shortDescription: A high fashion store that has art installations in some areas.
city_gems.longDescription: Art and fashion lovers can unite here to browse high-end brands and various art displays across 6 floors. Who knows what new brands you might find here?

city_gems.name: Flor de Café (Ki-no-Hana)
city_gems.shortDescription: A cozy vintage cafe located on the 2nd floor.
city_gems.longDescription: Get your curry and coffee fix in this cafe John Lennon and Yoko Ono once visited in 1979. It's a great spot for a solo afternoon or date.

city_gems.name: Kabukiza Theater
city_gems.shortDescription: A magnificent building that showcases one of Japan’s most traditional performances.
city_gems.longDescription: There are always plays going on and English audio guides are available for rent.

city_gems.name: Grill Bon
city_gems.shortDescription: Tender steak sandwiches best eaten on the spot.
city_gems.longDescription: High-quality steak packed between fluffy bread make the perfect light meal. The prices here are also affordable. The space is small with only 8 counter seats, so it's best to come with a smaller group.

city_gems.name: FEELSEEN
city_gems.shortDescription: A place to treat yourself to carefully selected artisan items.
city_gems.longDescription: Once sleeping quarters for kabuki actors, now houses a fine selection of items curated by a well-travelled couple.

city_gems.name: Craft Beer Bar iBrew Ginza
city_gems.shortDescription: A heaven of tiny label beers.
city_gems.longDescription: Get your craft beer fix in this restaurant, stocking both local and international options. Marvel at an impressive tap display and their 20 beer flight set.

city_gems.name: Turret Coffee
city_gems.shortDescription: Craft matcha latte by a former fish monger.
city_gems.longDescription: You can't miss the bright red bench outside this cafe. Both artsy and eccentric, the menu features seasonal lattes and hot spiced cider.

city_gems.name: Motodane
city_gems.shortDescription: Where you can get a 1.5 person portion of sushi at an unbeatable price.
city_gems.longDescription: Wonder what it's like to dine with a Japanese family? Wonder no more if you enter through the side entrance of this sushi restaurant (probably a part of the owner's house) where you are greeted by kind locals and served the freshest catch at unbeatable prices.

city_gems.name: Nihombashi Sando
city_gems.shortDescription: Modern izakaya with classic dishes.
city_gems.longDescription: The izakaya to go to if you are looking to sample Japanese dishes of the highest quality. Fresh sashimi, perfectly fried cream croquettes, and sake from Nagano are among visitor's favorites here.

city_gems.name: Bongen Coffee
city_gems.shortDescription: Bonsai, zen and a milky cup of latte.
city_gems.longDescription: It may be tiny but the coffee here packs a punch. Its bonsai logo is iconic and well-known, so don't be surprised to see a queue forming outside. Coffee made with premium Geisha beans is also available for purchase here.

city_gems.name: Maru
city_gems.shortDescription: A hidden wine and dine spot.
city_gems.longDescription: If you're a wine lover, you can't skip this spot. You'll be impressed by the bottles of wine lined up along the wall. Tapas served there includes asparagus gratin and anchovy butter fries that will satisfy any light cravings.

city_gems.name: Burger Shop Do
city_gems.shortDescription: Bite into juicy burgers here.
city_gems.longDescription: Good burgers are sometimes hard to come by in Tokyo, but this shop has your back. Aside from the classics, you can check out their weekly burgers in store. They also serve free vegetable juice on the side.

city_gems.name: 2F Coffee
city_gems.shortDescription: Perfect for an afternoon tea snack.
city_gems.longDescription: Need a quiet afternoon to yourself to read? This laidback cafe has the right atmosphere for it. Have a muffin or pudding to go with your coffee here.

data.name: Asakusa
data.description: Step back in time with temples, traditional crafts, and the tastiest street eats in town.

city_gems.name: Hamorebi Coffee
city_gems.shortDescription: Cafe with a heavy wood interior and quiet atmosphere.
city_gems.longDescription: Sip on a tumeric latte or a coffee of your choice in this cafe that used to be a sake shop.

city_gems.name: Sushi Kikumasa
city_gems.shortDescription: Run by a friendly sushi chef and his family.
city_gems.longDescription: This restaurant may be narrow but it is incredibly inviting. It's a family-run business and the owner does not speak much English but loves to communicate with foreigners. The sushi selection is well-priced and the fish is super fresh.

city_gems.name: Yuwaeru Main Store
city_gems.shortDescription: Serves sticky brown rice lunch sets.
city_gems.longDescription: A rare find - brown rice being served in Tokyo. This restaurant focuses on putting together healthy seat meals by assembling different small dishes and pairing it with a side of brown rice and miso soup. One part of the store is also dedicated to selling ingredients you can buy to prepare your own meal at home.

city_gems.name: Camera
city_gems.shortDescription: A quick coffee and pastry stop with handcrafted leather goods.
city_gems.longDescription: Spotting an interesting name and logo, this cafe is known for its great selection of muffins and scones. Savory meals like spam onigiri and curry rice are also available. There is also a small display of handcrafted leather goods for sale.

city_gems.name: Tokyo Pixel
city_gems.shortDescription: Quirky gallery across Section L Kuramae.
city_gems.longDescription: Split into 2 areas, this stop has a gallery at the front and a shop selling goods from independent artists at the back. There is usually a new exhibition every 2 weeks.

city_gems.name: Arkraft
city_gems.shortDescription: Pick up an original handmade watch here.
city_gems.longDescription: Intricate handmade watches in both classic and modern style are on sale here, custom-made options available. The shop gives off a bit of a Steampunk vibe.

city_gems.name: Konohanano Brewery
city_gems.shortDescription: A sake brewery offering quirky flavors.
city_gems.longDescription: Over 100 types of sake available in this brewery to sample with small dishes.

city_gems.name: Yello
city_gems.shortDescription: Standing izakaya serving the best lemon sours.
city_gems.longDescription: Enjoy unique potato salad, fresh lemon sours, and juicy fried chicken here. Look out for the mini fridge stocked full of lemons at the back.

city_gems.name: Bon Hanabi
city_gems.shortDescription: A casual izakaya with terrace seating and a view of Sumida River.
city_gems.longDescription: Classic izakaya dishes served on appetizing plateware. Though the staff do not know English, they are vwey welcoming to foreigners.

city_gems.name: Koncent
city_gems.shortDescription: Home goods store that stocks innovative products.
city_gems.longDescription: The items here are unique and are seem to be inspired by Japanese and Scandinavian design.

city_gems.name: inkstand by kakimori
city_gems.shortDescription: Aesthetic stationery store with a focus on fountain pens/
city_gems.longDescription: You can custom make a notebook and choose from a large selection of fountain pens and inks here. The wood surfaces spot colored strokes in neat patterns, making it a photo-worthy spot.

city_gems.name: McLean Burger Stand
city_gems.shortDescription: Best place to settle a burger craving.
city_gems.longDescription: Dig into mouth-watering burgers and sandwiches and thick milkshakes here. There are over 10 kinds of burgers here to choose from.

city_gems.name: Kawamura Leather
city_gems.shortDescription: You’ll find almost any kind of leather you need for crafts here.
city_gems.longDescription: This shop has been around since 1932. You can pick up high quality leather here or discounted scraps or smaller items at extremely affordable prices.

city_gems.name: Fakalo Pizza Gallery
city_gems.shortDescription: A futuristic-looking pizza shop.
city_gems.longDescription: Houses a pizza oven made from a Japanese delivery truck! Vegetarian options available.

city_gems.name: Soko Ando An
city_gems.shortDescription: Well-curated antique store.
city_gems.longDescription: If you're a bargain or thrift hunter, it's worth peeking into this shop with a low ceiling. You never know what you might find.

city_gems.name: Canele
city_gems.shortDescription: A shop dedicated to the classic French pastry.
city_gems.longDescription: Dessert stand with a second floor cafe attached where you can sit and savor this French pastry.

city_gems.name: GINZA RECORDS & AUDIO KURAMAE
city_gems.shortDescription: Great spot to check out for audiophiles.
city_gems.longDescription: Browse through records and soak up music with state-of-the-art speakers here.

city_gems.name: Bar Boushu
city_gems.shortDescription: An atmospheric bar that serves bespoke drinks.
city_gems.longDescription: The bar logo features penguins having wine, this unassuming bar’s mysterious interior and well-stocked shelves are worth checking out.

city_gems.name: Lattest Mizumachi & Sports
city_gems.shortDescription: A playground with coffee for the active ones, both young and old.
city_gems.longDescription: Coffee? Bikes? Bouldering? There's something for everyone here. This multi-purpose area is a good spot to spend an afternoon relaxing or burning calories.

city_gems.name: Voyage Side
city_gems.shortDescription: The best loaves and jams in the neighborhood.
city_gems.longDescription: A simple bakery that houses a classic selection of Japanese bread. Popular items here include a thick loaf with a generous swirl of sweet fillings.

city_gems.name: Pain Maison
city_gems.shortDescription: Soft, tasty salt bread fresh from the oven.
city_gems.longDescription: Buttery and chewy goodness priced between 110-170yen, offering a range of different fillings from sweet to savory. Be prepared to queue a little while for this popular bread!

city_gems.name: Inagaki
city_gems.shortDescription: A family-run Izakaya that everyone loves.
city_gems.longDescription: This izakaya is known for its grilled skewers, but its menu is extensive, featuring sashimi, grilled fish, and a few other fried foods too. An English menu is available here.

city_gems.name: Mirindo
city_gems.shortDescription: A historical rice cracker shop.
city_gems.longDescription: A treat for rice cracker fans, here is where you can buy different kinds, even soft ones! Interesting items on sale include a Tokyo Skytree rice cracker and also ice cream sandwiched between rice crackers - the perfect snack for those who can't decide between sweet and savory.

city_gems.name: Unlimited Coffee Bar
city_gems.shortDescription: A world-class barista lab.
city_gems.longDescription: A cafe close to Tokyo Skytree that offers interesting seasonal flavors. If you can't decide what to try, you can opt to have a coffee flight!

city_gems.name: Kiyokawa Shoten
city_gems.shortDescription: A local leather meister.
city_gems.longDescription: A variety of leather goods are sold here, made from deer skin with special patterned imprints on them. The price may be high but it's a souvenir from Japan you can use for life.

city_gems.name: Shigeno Coffee Craft
city_gems.shortDescription: An unforgettable roastery experience.
city_gems.longDescription: The owner Shigekazu has been roasting beans for over 40 years and is a master at making his own blends. Though the space is small, it feels cozy and the owner is welcoming to foreigners. You can order from an English menu.

city_gems.name: Infinity Books
city_gems.shortDescription: An infinite selection of used English books.
city_gems.longDescription: This bookstore stocks a solid selection of used English books at affordable prices. Once in a while, it also hosts open mic sessions or live music.

city_gems.name: Komado Bakery
city_gems.shortDescription: A tiny bakery to stop by.
city_gems.longDescription: It has an eye-catching window to display its bread that is sure to whet your appetite. Scones are also sold here - a rare find in Japan!

city_gems.name: Nishizawa
city_gems.shortDescription: Sake from all over Japan.
city_gems.longDescription: A sake specialty store that offers samples and tastings - a great spot to get a gift for a special occasion.

city_gems.name: Almost Perfect
city_gems.shortDescription: Mini gallery in a century old rice shop.
city_gems.longDescription: Couple Luis and Yuka run this place as a gathering spot for creatives and the art showcased here is often by foreign artists. Note: It is open only when there are shows.

city_gems.name: Hat Coffee
city_gems.shortDescription: An Instagrammable coffee experience.
city_gems.longDescription: Pick a character of your choice to be converted into 3D latte art - all you need to do is a have the digital photo ready on your phone.

data.name: Toranomon
data.description: Enjoy a mix of contemporary skyscrapers, peaceful green spaces, and a thriving food culture.

city_gems.name: Peace Coffee Roasters
city_gems.shortDescription: Cafe with an impressive coffee drip display.
city_gems.longDescription: This is a great place for grabbing coffee to catch up with a friend or come to solo to read a book. It also serves a delectable range of pastries.

city_gems.name: Sustainable Food Museum
city_gems.shortDescription: Learn about the latest sustainable food inventions from different countries here.
city_gems.longDescription: Part museum, part cafe, you can spend a little bit of time reading about the different kinds of sustainable food and items on display here. This spot also sells healthy onigiri and occasionally holds educational events.

city_gems.name: Atelier Yamagata
city_gems.shortDescription: A shop that repurposes kimono into novelty items.
city_gems.longDescription: A shop that flies under a radar. It is run by a kind older lady who creates small pouches and other accessories out of different kimono fabrics.

city_gems.name: Sowa
city_gems.shortDescription: Handmade ice cream available in unique local flavors.
city_gems.longDescription: Try gelato, soft serve, and sherbet in this cute little shop that has been opened since 1955. Enjoy local flavors like sesame, matcha, red bean. Look out for seasonal flavors like watermelon and cinnamon.

city_gems.name: Nandhini
city_gems.shortDescription: Tokyo's best South Indian restaurant.
city_gems.longDescription: This is a restaurant loved by both locals and visitors for its authentic flavors. The chefs, who come from South India, bring their expertise to dishes like biryani, chicken Hyderabadi, dosas, and paneer curries, all made with a lot of care. It offers vegan and vegetarian options, making it a versatile choice for different dietary preferences.

city_gems.name: Shinshodoh
city_gems.shortDescription: Famous for a specialty bean cake great as a souvenir.
city_gems.longDescription: If you're looking for sweet souvenirs to bring back, here's a good spot to drop by! Try their famous Seppuku Monaka, a Japanese wafer cake overflowing with red bean. Other seasonal sweets are also available.

city_gems.name: T-Market
city_gems.shortDescription: Food options for indecisive parties in a very cool space.
city_gems.longDescription: Possibly the coolest food court in Tokyo - a dim-lit setting, lots of plants, and trendy food options ranging from modern Japanese to ethnic fusion dishes.

city_gems.name: Seishoji Temple
city_gems.shortDescription: Zen Buddhist temple in the middle of the city.
city_gems.longDescription: Find peace and tranquility in the middle of the city here. It also offers monthly  Zen meditation sessions, though it is only available in Japanese at the moment.

city_gems.name: Azabudai Hills
city_gems.shortDescription: Luxury shopping experiences contained in eye-catching architecture.
city_gems.longDescription: Part of this area is Japan’s tallest skyscraper, luxury residences, offices, and over 150 retail outlets, including high-end fashion, gourmet dining, and wellness facilities. It blends urban living with cultural spaces and green landscapes, all designed with a focus on sustainability.

city_gems.name: Atago Shrine
city_gems.shortDescription: A beautiful shrine with iconic stairs leading up to it.
city_gems.longDescription: It is a historic Shinto shrine founded in the early 1600s, famous for its steep 86-step staircase. There's a belief that conquering them in leads to success in life. From the top is a beautiful view, which used to serve as a safety point for residents to watch out for fires or escape to in the event of a fire.

data.name: Tsukiji
data.description: The sushi paradise of Japan, where fresh catch and collection-worthy kitchenware can be bought.

city_gems.name: Kunisuke Coffee
city_gems.shortDescription: Forest vibes on the outside, cozy on the inside.
city_gems.longDescription: This cozy cafe overgrown with plants sells coffees and a delectable selection of ever-changing pastries. It also hosts puzzle games in Japanese on the second floor.

city_gems.name: Namiyoke Shrine
city_gems.shortDescription: A shrine to stop by when visiting Tsukiji Market.
city_gems.longDescription: Home to two giant lion heads for you to marvel at, this shrine sits just outside Tsukiji Market. Historically, it exists to protect the market from waves.

city_gems.name: Tsuki to Shumai
city_gems.shortDescription: Try Chinese dumplings in Tokyo.
city_gems.longDescription: Order a side of huge traditional Chinese dumplings with your set meals here. Rice and ramen options are available.

city_gems.name: Totoya
city_gems.shortDescription: A grilled chicken bowl specialty store.
city_gems.longDescription: Not a fan of raw fish? Feast on a tasty grilled chicken rice bowl instead. At just 1000~yen, you can enjoy juicy chicken pieces over rice with a side of tasty chicken soup.

city_gems.name: Fish Burger Masa
city_gems.shortDescription: Tsukiji's only fish burger store.
city_gems.longDescription: If you're on a fish feast, stop by this store tucked away in an alley for a crispy catch of the day sandwiched between soft buns. You can also choose other fish for your burger, depending on availabililty.

city_gems.name: Tsukiji Croquette
city_gems.shortDescription: Photogenic potato croquettes.
city_gems.longDescription: There's almost always a queue and when you get your hands on one, you'll understand why. Pick from various toppings like mentaiko, kimchi, and bonito, all generously piled onto a piping hot and crunchy potato croquette.

city_gems.name: Shouro
city_gems.shortDescription: A tamagoyaki specialty store.
city_gems.longDescription: Eggs in different forms! From sandwiches to milkshakes, everything contains eggs here and their most popular items is their tamagoyaki (Japanese rolled omelette).

city_gems.name: Shutoku Ganso
city_gems.shortDescription: Omakase sushi hidden in an alley.
city_gems.longDescription: Only 8 seats in here and 3 courses to choose from. The dining experience feels private and you can look forward to the chef's special selection of sushi.

city_gems.name: Ichifuji
city_gems.shortDescription: Pick up a unique souvenir here!
city_gems.longDescription: If you want a practical souvenir, look no further! Ichifuji stocks a wide selection of kitchenware that can find a new home with you or serve as a special gift for someone.

city_gems.name: Kunizakeya
city_gems.shortDescription: A sake bar hidden from the streets.
city_gems.longDescription: For both new and seasoned sake lovers, this standing sake bar offers sake from 47 prefectures in a warm ambience.

city_gems.name: Imazu
city_gems.shortDescription: A restaurant with value-for-money sashimi lunch sets.
city_gems.longDescription: Visited mainly by the locals, each meal is cooked carefully by the chef and ingredients used in it are seasonal. The lunch menu is extensive, offering both raw and cooked options with rice. Their chirashi-don is extremely popular.

city_gems.name: Taketonbo
city_gems.shortDescription: Ramen with a chicken soup base.
city_gems.longDescription: Enjoy thick yellow noodles in a well-balanced broth. Wonton (Chinese dumplings) are also offered as a topping.

city_gems.name: Chosei-an
city_gems.shortDescription: A traditional soba restaurant that serves maguro rice bowls.
city_gems.longDescription: Opening at 7am in the moment, you'll find more locals in here than tourists. They have both hot and cold soba options and if you need to get your fish fix, try their maguro rice bowl.

city_gems.name: Orimine Bakery
city_gems.shortDescription: Find a unique selection of bread here.
city_gems.longDescription: With a recognizable Western-style green window at the front, this bakery makes heads turn while walking past. It has its own original line of bread, the most unique being their octopus foccacia.

city_gems.name: Kagura-sushi
city_gems.shortDescription: Serves Edo-style sushi.
city_gems.longDescription: Staff here are friendly to foreigners and it's recommended to visit here and it's recommended to try the sushi sets they have available.

city_gems.name: Rockado Factory
city_gems.shortDescription: The best cream puff store in Tsukiji.
city_gems.longDescription: Offering both pastries and cream puff, each puff is prepared freshly ordering.

city_gems.name: Shubiduba
city_gems.shortDescription: A social standing drinking spot.
city_gems.longDescription: With the guidance of knowledgeable staff, you can try a 1000yen sake flight, warm amazake, or wine.

city_gems.name: Stand 88
city_gems.shortDescription: Wine and wagyu - a casual fine dining experience.
city_gems.longDescription: Treat yourself to melt-in-your-mouth wagyu sushi, sandwiches and skewers in this shop hidden away from the main street. Top it off with a glass of wine.

city_gems.name: Honganji
city_gems.shortDescription: Buddhist temple standing since the 17th century.
city_gems.longDescription: The architecture here is India-inspired and serves as a tranquil escape from crowded streets. It is also illuminated at night.

city_gems.name: Craft Beer Bar iBrew Ginza
city_gems.shortDescription: A heaven of tiny label beers.
city_gems.longDescription: Get your craft beer fix in this restaurant, stocking both local and international options. Marvel at an impressive tap display and their 20 beer flight set.

city_gems.name: Turret Coffee
city_gems.shortDescription: Craft matcha latte by a former fish monger.
city_gems.longDescription: You can't miss the bright red bench outside this cafe. Both artsy and eccentric, the menu features seasonal lattes and hot spiced cider.

city_gems.name: Motodane
city_gems.shortDescription: Where you can get a 1.5 person portion of sushi at an unbeatable price.
city_gems.longDescription: Wonder what it's like to dine with a Japanese family? Wonder no more if you enter through the side entrance of this sushi restaurant (probably a part of the owner's house) where you are greeted by kind locals and served the freshest catch at unbeatable prices.

city_gems.name: Nihombashi Sando
city_gems.shortDescription: Modern izakaya with classic dishes.
city_gems.longDescription: The izakaya to go to if you are looking to sample Japanese dishes of the highest quality. Fresh sashimi, perfectly fried cream croquettes, and sake from Nagano are among visitor's favorites here.

city_gems.name: Bongen Coffee
city_gems.shortDescription: Bonsai, zen and a milky cup of latte.
city_gems.longDescription: It may be tiny but the coffee here packs a punch. Its bonsai logo is iconic and well-known, so don't be surprised to see a queue forming outside. Coffee made with premium Geisha beans is also available for purchase here.

city_gems.name: Maru
city_gems.shortDescription: A hidden wine and dine spot.
city_gems.longDescription: If you're a wine lover, you can't skip this spot. You'll be impressed by the bottles of wine lined up along the wall. Tapas served there includes asparagus gratin and anchovy butter fries that will satisfy any light cravings.

city_gems.name: Burger Shop Do
city_gems.shortDescription: Bite into juicy burgers here.
city_gems.longDescription: Good burgers are sometimes hard to come by in Tokyo, but this shop has your back. Aside from the classics, you can check out their weekly burgers in store. They also serve free vegetable juice on the side.

city_gems.name: 2F Coffee
city_gems.shortDescription: Perfect for an afternoon tea snack.
city_gems.longDescription: Need a quiet afternoon to yourself to read? This laidback cafe has the right atmosphere for it. Have a muffin or pudding to go with your coffee here.

data.name: Kuramae
data.description: The Brooklyn of Tokyo, filled with trendy cafes and shops selling artisan items.

city_gems.name: Hamorebi Coffee
city_gems.shortDescription: Cafe with a heavy wood interior and quiet atmosphere.
city_gems.longDescription: Sip on a tumeric latte or a coffee of your choice in this cafe that used to be a sake shop.

city_gems.name: Sushi Kikumasa
city_gems.shortDescription: Run by a friendly sushi chef and his family.
city_gems.longDescription: This restaurant may be narrow but it is incredibly inviting. It's a family-run business and the owner does not speak much English but loves to communicate with foreigners. The sushi selection is well-priced and the fish is super fresh.

city_gems.name: Yuwaeru Main Store
city_gems.shortDescription: Serves sticky brown rice lunch sets.
city_gems.longDescription: A rare find - brown rice being served in Tokyo. This restaurant focuses on putting together healthy seat meals by assembling different small dishes and pairing it with a side of brown rice and miso soup. One part of the store is also dedicated to selling ingredients you can buy to prepare your own meal at home.

city_gems.name: Camera
city_gems.shortDescription: A quick coffee and pastry stop with handcrafted leather goods.
city_gems.longDescription: Spotting an interesting name and logo, this cafe is known for its great selection of muffins and scones. Savory meals like spam onigiri and curry rice are also available. There is also a small display of handcrafted leather goods for sale.

city_gems.name: Tokyo Pixel
city_gems.shortDescription: Quirky gallery across Section L Kuramae.
city_gems.longDescription: Split into 2 areas, this stop has a gallery at the front and a shop selling goods from independent artists at the back. There is usually a new exhibition every 2 weeks.

city_gems.name: Arkraft
city_gems.shortDescription: Pick up an original handmade watch here.
city_gems.longDescription: Intricate handmade watches in both classic and modern style are on sale here, custom-made options available. The shop gives off a bit of a Steampunk vibe.

city_gems.name: Konohanano Brewery
city_gems.shortDescription: A sake brewery offering quirky flavors.
city_gems.longDescription: Over 100 types of sake available in this brewery to sample with small dishes.

city_gems.name: Yello
city_gems.shortDescription: Standing izakaya serving the best lemon sours.
city_gems.longDescription: Enjoy unique potato salad, fresh lemon sours, and juicy fried chicken here. Look out for the mini fridge stocked full of lemons at the back.

city_gems.name: Hat Coffee
city_gems.shortDescription: An Instagrammable coffee experience.
city_gems.longDescription: Pick a character of your choice to be converted into 3D latte art - all you need to do is a have the digital photo ready on your phone.

city_gems.name: Almost Perfect
city_gems.shortDescription: Mini gallery in a century old rice shop.
city_gems.longDescription: Couple Luis and Yuka run this place as a gathering spot for creatives and the art showcased here is often by foreign artists. Note: It is open only when there are shows.

city_gems.name: Bon Hanabi
city_gems.shortDescription: A casual izakaya with terrace seating and a view of Sumida River.
city_gems.longDescription: Classic izakaya dishes served on appetizing plateware. Though the staff do not know English, they are vwey welcoming to foreigners.

city_gems.name: Koncent
city_gems.shortDescription: Home goods store that stocks innovative products.
city_gems.longDescription: The items here are unique and are seem to be inspired by Japanese and Scandinavian design.

city_gems.name: inkstand by kakimori
city_gems.shortDescription: Aesthetic stationery store with a focus on fountain pens/
city_gems.longDescription: You can custom make a notebook and choose from a large selection of fountain pens and inks here. The wood surfaces spot colored strokes in neat patterns, making it a photo-worthy spot.

city_gems.name: McLean Burger Stand
city_gems.shortDescription: Best place to settle a burger craving.
city_gems.longDescription: Dig into mouth-watering burgers and sandwiches and thick milkshakes here. There are over 10 kinds of burgers here to choose from.

city_gems.name: Kawamura Leather
city_gems.shortDescription: You’ll find almost any kind of leather you need for crafts here.
city_gems.longDescription: This shop has been around since 1932. You can pick up high quality leather here or discounted scraps or smaller items at extremely affordable prices.

city_gems.name: Fakalo Pizza Gallery
city_gems.shortDescription: A futuristic-looking pizza shop.
city_gems.longDescription: Houses a pizza oven made from a Japanese delivery truck! Vegetarian options available.

city_gems.name: Soko Ando An
city_gems.shortDescription: Well-curated antique store.
city_gems.longDescription: If you're a bargain or thrift hunter, it's worth peeking into this shop with a low ceiling. You never know what you might find.

city_gems.name: Canele
city_gems.shortDescription: A shop dedicated to the classic French pastry.
city_gems.longDescription: Dessert stand with a second floor cafe attached where you can sit and savor this French pastry.

city_gems.name: GINZA RECORDS & AUDIO KURAMAE
city_gems.shortDescription: Great spot to check out for audiophiles.
city_gems.longDescription: Browse through records and soak up music with state-of-the-art speakers here.

city_gems.name: Bar Boushu
city_gems.shortDescription: An atmospheric bar that serves bespoke drinks.
city_gems.longDescription: The bar logo features penguins having wine, this unassuming bar’s mysterious interior and well-stocked shelves are worth checking out.

city_gems.name: good good not bad
city_gems.shortDescription: Early morning spot for sweet treats and cafe drinks.
city_gems.longDescription: Come here if you're an early bird or if you're craving an acai drink - those are hard to come by!

city_gems.name: æ - ash
city_gems.shortDescription: Coffee cocktails are the highlight in this zero waste bar.
city_gems.longDescription: It's all about the aesthetic and monochrome vibes here. Sweet cravings can also be satisfied easily.

city_gems.name: Kinka Sushi Bar
city_gems.shortDescription: Stylish sushi bar with omakase courses and classic desserts.
city_gems.longDescription: Great for larger groups.

city_gems.name: Torahebi Coffee
city_gems.shortDescription: An artistic and aromatic cafe that offers a sake blend coffee.
city_gems.longDescription: Settle down in this bold space with baristas happy to share the complex process behind brewing these drinks.

city_gems.name: Style Department
city_gems.shortDescription: Stylish clothing store with rotating pop-ups.
city_gems.longDescription: Located in a trendy residential area with more cafes and artisan shops to discover.

city_gems.name: Masaka
city_gems.shortDescription: The vegan gyoza and karaage get raved about here.
city_gems.longDescription: There are a huge variety of standard izakaya dishes.

city_gems.name: Theatre Image Forum
city_gems.shortDescription: An indie cinema with a Brutalist exterior.
city_gems.longDescription: Shows both international and domestic films.

city_gems.name: Ramen Nukaji
city_gems.shortDescription: Hole-in-the-wall ramen restaurant with craft beer.
city_gems.longDescription: Centrally located and offers an English menu.
